results.title: Force of the wind
results.creator_credit: Justin Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Justin Somerville never thought he would be in the middle of a tornado, so his first reaction was that he wanted to witness this phenomena. His account of the aftermath provides detail well beyond the media coverage of the devestation of this small town.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: A Trail of destruction
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The whole thing probably lasted about twenty seconds, but for Jeremy Somerville, his family and community, it is an event they will never forget.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Under the stairs
results.creator_credit: Emily Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
When Emily Somerville first heard the loud bangs in the morning, she thought it was her family making the noise. When she realised it was more serious than that, Somerville and her family took shelter under the stairs, surviving the tornado but finding it hard to control her emotions afterwards.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: The Big roar
results.creator_credit: Daniel Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Daniel Young didn’t feel safe the night before the tornado roared through his house. After it had passed, Young’s family were safe but it had left a great wave of destruction in its path.

On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Yellow morning
results.creator_credit: Caitlin Foley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Over breakfast, Caitlin Foley and her family spotted a tornado coming from over the water. Caitlin’s mum said they never make it onto the land. Despite hitting the community so suddenly and quickly, the tornado left physical and emotional devastation in its wake.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: A Disastrous day
results.creator_credit: Abby Dietrich, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was a typical morning in Lennox Head for Abby Dietrich and her mother, when things changed dramatically. A tornado and intense storm were followed by calls from friends and family, and the community checking up on each other, helping out and cleaning up.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Abby Dietrich, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My truth
results.creator_credit: Vladimir Keca, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vladimir Keca lived a sheltered life in a remote part of the former Yugoslavia with his grandparents. But once war broke out, he was removed from his comfort zone and, while it changed everything, Keca is not so sure that it was all bad.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vladimir Keca, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

group.title: Legacy : a promise for the future : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: Innamorati
results.brief_description:
Assembled from family photographs, home movies and background music, Roberta Ciabarra narrates a poignant story of her parent’s courtship and unusual marriage as they migrate separately to Australia to establish a new life.

First created as part of the pilot 3 day digital storytelling workshop conducted at Cinemedia by Nina Mullen and Joe Lambert from the Center for Digital Storytelling, Berkeley, CA.

results.title: Y2K a post mortem
results.brief_description: The global impact of the Millennium Bug runs deep in the commercial and cultural community. Y2K offered consumerist societies not only promise. What were the official responses to the Y2K phenomenon and what was the effect of prophesy on the public imagination and the personal psyche of the electronic age? This post-mortem examined the relationship between millennial tension, popular culture, information technologies, artists and the media, the psychology of mass panic and cultural anxiety, and the Millennium Bug as metaphor for collective apocalyptic fears.

results.title: RMIT AIM Collection 1993
results.brief_description:
Compilation of student work from the University of RMIT Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) Department. 1993.
The Centre for Animation and Interactive Media, its courses, facilities, staff and collection of work was transferred from Swinburne University of Technology to RMIT University in 1995.
